poem:
Title: "Victory, Veiled in January's Dry Chill" 

Justice laid its gloved hand upon the bar's dark oak,
A duel lit by the flashing bulbs of never-shuttered truth,
January, sober witness, stood holding dry stillness cloak. 

Mirth, misfortune met in the failing day's heart;
Despite the dread notes of threats, thinly scaled,
The showman lives to paint the morning's art. 

This season simply another costume, draped and detailed.
